Class MainMenu

java.lang.Object
MainMenu
public class MainMenu extends Object
This class allows the user to navigate to all of the different "pages" of the program. Handles all menu navigation and user routing throughout the Personal Finance Manager application.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    MainMenu()
    Default constructor for MainMenu.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    displayAccountSettings()
    Prints the settings, so users can do things like change username and password and security questions.
    void
    displayMenu()
    Prints the Main menu, so users can see where they can navigate to within the program.

    Lets the user exit the program to desktop from anywhere within the code.

    getUserChoice(int numChoice)
    Gets the user's choice of where they want to navigate to and sends them there.

  • Constructor Details

    • MainMenu

      public MainMenu()
      Default constructor for MainMenu.

  • Method Details

    • displayMenu

      public void displayMenu()
      Prints the Main menu, so users can see where they can navigate to within the program.

    • getUserChoice

      public boolean getUserChoice(int numChoice)
      Gets the user's choice of where they want to navigate to and sends them there.
      Parameters:
      numChoice - the user's selected menu option
      Returns:
      true if a valid choice was made, otherwise false

    • returnToMenu

      public void returnToMenu()
      Returns the user to the main menu. If they are within a table of contents or a module and would like to go to a different "page", then they can return to the main menu and select where they would like to go next.

    • returnToModules

      public void returnToModules()
      Return the user to a table of contents of modules. If they are within a module and would like to go to a different module, then they can return to the list of modules and select the next module that they would like to view.

    • exitProgram

      public void exitProgram()
      Lets the user exit the program to desktop from anywhere within the code.

    • displayAccountSettings

      public void displayAccountSettings()
      Prints the settings, so users can do things like change username and password and security questions.
